mata_info.title: What is a Nidhi Company?
mata_info.description: “Nidhi” is a Hindi word, which means finance or fund. Nidhi Company Registration is done with an intention to cultivate savings among members and to provide finance among members only. It is allowed to take loans from members and can lend to only members. Hence, it can not accept deposits or lend from/to non-members.

content: Though there are no separate registrations to be done under RBI for a Nidhi company, RBI is empowered to issue any directives to them. Nidhi Companies are as such exempted from main provisions otherwise applicable to an NBFC in India. It requires minimum 7 members and 3 directors to start with. As a part of suffix, all such companies must append “Nidhi Limited” after its name. Nidhi Company is very easy to form and there are minimum compliances afterward. You may visit here to know all about loans that Nidhi company can offer and interest rates that it can charge.

list.title: Encourages Savings
list.description: Nidhi Companies are designed to encourage savings among members, promoting financial discipline and a culture of thrift.

list.title: Easy to Manage
list.description: The operational structure of a Nidhi Company is simple, making it easier to manage compared to other types of financial institutions.

list.title: Limited Liability
list.description: The liability of the members is limited to the amount of their capital contribution. This means personal assets of the members are protected.

list.title: Less Stringent Regulations
list.description: Compared to other financial institutions, Nidhi Companies are subject to fewer compliance requirements and less stringent regulations from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI).

list.title: Exemption from Certain Provisions
list.description: Nidhi Companies enjoy exemptions from certain provisions of the Companies Act, which simplifies their operations and compliance requirements.

list.title: Restricted to Members Only
list.description: Nidhi Companies can only accept deposits and lend money to their members, limiting their customer base and potential for growth.

list.title: Regulatory Constraints
list.description: Despite having fewer compliance requirements, Nidhi Companies are still subject to strict regulations under the Nidhi Rules, 2014, which can be challenging to navigate.

list.title: Geographical Limitations
list.description: Nidhi Companies are typically restricted to operating within a specific region or state, limiting their ability to expand nationwide.

list.title: No External Borrowing
list.description: Nidhi Companies are prohibited from borrowing funds from external sources, which can limit their capital and ability to meet large financial demands.

list.title: Lack of Professional Management
list.description: Nidhi Companies are often managed by their members, who may lack professional expertise in financial management, leading to potential operational inefficiencies.

isnCol.head: Advantages of Nidhi Company
isnCol.sub_head: Points to make your decision easy

list.title: Separate Legal Entity
list.description: A Nidhi Company enjoys the benefit of Separate Legal Identity in the eyes of law which clearly states that assets and liabilities of the business are not the assets and liabilities of the Directors.

list.title: Cultivates Savings
list.description: A Nidhi Co. encourages its members to save money and encourages a thrifty lifestyle. It is a company wherein members can lend or borrow money and accept financial loans amongst themselves.

list.title: Transferability
list.description: Interest in Nidhi Company can be easily transferred by transferring its shares. Its board of management is easily transferable as such. This is effected through filing of forms with ROC.

list.title: Cheap Borrowings
list.description: Members, when in need, can borrow from the company at bank rates. This can really come handy in case of need and rates are comparatively very cheap in comparison to other sources of finance.

list.title: Mutual Benefits
list.description: A Nidhi Company operates on principles of mutual benefits. No one member or a group of members get benefited. Nidhi Company allows right to every member to access credit facilities when in need.

list.title: Builds Credibility
list.description: All the information relating to the company are made available in a public database. This feature makes it easy to authenticate the existence of the business that ultimately helps in improving business credibility.

left.question: What are the requirements of a Nidhi company incorporation?
left.answer: A Nidhi company is registered as a Public Limited Company. Hence, the requirements for incorporation of a Nidhi company cover a minimum of three Directors and Seven Shareholders. The Memorandum of Association (MOA) of a Nidhi company must state that the primary objective of the proposed company is to nurture and promote a habit of thriftiness and savings among its members, and accept deposits from or lend loans only to its members, for the mutual benefits of them.

left.question: Can I carry on my Nidhi company with 7 members?
left.answer: Yes, you can incorporate your Nidhi company with at least 7 members. However, within 1 year, you must have at least 200 members.

left.question: Can a Nidhi company lend to an outsider?
left.answer: No, a Nidhi company cannot lend to an outsider who is a non-member.

left.question: Are there any caps on accepting deposits from members?
left.answer: Yes, a Nidhi company can accept deposits from its members not exceeding 20 times of its net owned assets as mentioned in the last audited financial statements.
